title: 115_s2031
content: The "Kisatchie National Forest Land Conveyance Act" authorizes the conveyance of certain Federal land in Louisiana for market value consideration. The Act defines terms like "Collins Camp Properties" and "Secretary" for clarity. The Secretary is authorized to convey Federal land in Louisiana by quitclaim deed at public or private sale. The land includes all Federal land within sec. 9, T. 10 N., R. 5 W., Winn Parish, Louisiana, and a 2.16-acre parcel in the SW\1/4\ of sec. 4, T. 10 N., R. 5 W. The First Right of Purchase is granted during a 1-year period after enactment. During a 1-year period after enactment, the Secretary is authorized to convey Federal land in Louisiana to Collins Camp Properties by quitclaim deed, including the Collins Campsites and a specified parcel. The Secretary may configure the land to maximize marketability. The Secretary is authorized to convey Federal land in Louisiana to Collins Camp Properties by quitclaim deed, with consideration in cash equal to the market value determined by an appraisal conducted in accordance with the Uniform standards. Terms and conditions for the conveyance are to be established to achieve management objectives or maximize marketability. In the conveyance of Federal land, the Secretary must follow appraisal standards and obtain approval for the valuation. Hazardous substances disclosure is required, but the Secretary is not obligated to remediate them. The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act still applies to Federal land conveyances. SEC. 5. PROCEEDS FROM THE SALE OF LAND. The Secretary shall deposit the proceeds of a conveyance of Federal land under section 4 in the fund established under Public Law 90-171 (commonly known as the ``Sisk Act'') (16 U.S.C. 484a). SEC. 6. ADMINISTRATION. Collins Camp Properties must pay reasonable appraisal costs and administrative/environmental analysis fees for the conveyance of Federal land. Offers for land acquisition must include a statement from Forest Service special use authorization holders agreeing to relinquish their authorization. Collins Camp Properties must administer special use authorizations if holders fail to provide written authorization.
